faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about Disclosurely

question1.question: How does anonymous reporting work?
question1.answer: Whistleblowers can submit reports through your custom portal without providing any personal information. Our system uses advanced encryption and doesn't collect IP addresses or identifying data. Reporters receive a unique access code to check their report status and communicate securely.

question2.question: Is Disclosurely compliant with GDPR and other regulations?
question2.answer: Yes, Disclosurely is built with compliance in mind. We're GDPR compliant and meet requirements for SOX, EU Whistleblowing Directive, and other major regulatory frameworks. All data is encrypted and stored securely in compliance with international data protection standards.

question3.question: Can we customize the reporting portal?
question3.answer: Absolutely. You can add your company branding, customize the reporting form fields, set up specific categories for reports, and even use your own domain (on Professional and Enterprise plans). The portal can be tailored to match your organization's needs and culture.

question4.question: How quickly can we get started?
question4.answer: Most organizations are up and running within 24 hours. After signing up, you can immediately customize your portal, invite team members, and start accepting reports. Our support team is available to help with setup and onboarding at no extra cost.

question5.question: What support is included?
question5.answer: All plans include email support and access to our comprehensive knowledge base. Professional plans include priority support with faster response times, while Enterprise customers receive dedicated support with SLA guarantees and optional on-site training.

question6.question: Can we cancel or change our plan anytime?
question6.answer: Yes, you can upgrade, downgrade, or cancel your subscription at any time. If you cancel, you'll retain access until the end of your billing period. We also offer a 14-day free trial so you can test all features before committing.

cta.title: Ready to Strengthen Your Compliance Program?
cta.description: Not ready for a free trial or demo? Share your requirements with us, and we'll respond quickly to discuss how Disclosurely can support your organisation.

hero.title: Simple, Transparent Pricing
hero.subtitle: Choose the plan that's right for your organisation. Start with our seven day free trial and upgrade as you grow.

trial.question: Is there a free trial?
trial.answer: Yes, all plans come with a 7-day free trial so you can see how the platform works and how you can use it in your organisation. No credit card required.

limit.question: What happens if I reach my case limit on the Starter plan?
limit.answer: If you exceed your monthly case allowance, you'll be notified in the dashboard. You can either upgrade to the Pro plan for unlimited cases or wait until the next month when your allowance resets.

change.question: Can I change plans later?
change.answer: Absolutely! You can upgrade or downgrade your plan at any time from your dashboard.

security.question: What security certifications do you have?
security.answer: We're ISO 27001 certified, SOC 2 Type II compliant, and GDPR ready.

hero.title: Privacy Policy
hero.description: Learn how we protect your personal data and respect your privacy.

introduction.title: 1. Introduction
introduction.content1: Disclosurely Limited ("Disclosurely", "we", "us" or "our") is committed to protecting your personal data and respecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, store and protect your personal data when you use our whistleblowing platform at disclosurely.com (the "Service").
introduction.content2: We comply with the General Data Protection Regulation (EU 2016/679), the UK GDPR (as enacted in the Data Protection Act 2018), and other applicable data protection laws.

dataController.title: 2. Data Controller and Data Processor
dataController.content1: When we provide the Service to organisations (the "Customer"), that organisation acts as the Data Controller for whistleblower reports and any personal data it collects.
dataController.content2: Disclosurely acts as the Data Processor, processing personal data only on the Customer's documented instructions.
dataController.content3: For data related to your own use of disclosurely.com (e.g. your account, billing), Disclosurely is the Data Controller.

personalData.title: 3. Personal Data We Collect
personalData.content1: We may collect and process the following categories of data:

items.1: Information you choose to submit in a report (which may include personal data, sensitive data, or special category data)
items.2: Optional contact details if you choose to provide them
items.3: Metadata such as IP address, browser type, device information (unless anonymised reporting is enabled)

items.1: Log files, usage statistics, and cookies (essential for site functionality)
items.2: Security and access data for auditing and fraud prevention

usage.title: 4. How We Use Personal Data
usage.content1: We use personal data for the following purposes:

items.1: To provide, maintain and improve the Service
items.2: To authenticate and manage user accounts
items.4: To ensure the security and integrity of reports and communications
items.5: To comply with legal obligations and cooperate with regulatory authorities
items.6: For internal analytics (in anonymised and aggregated form only)

legalBases.title: 5. Legal Bases for Processing
legalBases.content1: We process personal data on the following legal bases:

contractual.label: Contractual necessity –
contractual.content: to provide the Service you subscribe to

legitimate.label: Legitimate interests –
legitimate.content: to improve the Service, maintain security, and prevent fraud

legal.label: Legal obligations –
legal.content: to comply with applicable laws and regulations

consent.label: Consent –
consent.content: when you voluntarily provide sensitive or optional data

dataHosting.title: 6. Data Hosting and Transfers
dataHosting.content1: All data is hosted in Western EU (Ireland) on secure Supabase infrastructure.
dataHosting.content2: Data is not transferred outside the European Economic Area (EEA) or the UK, unless adequate safeguards are in place (such as Standard Contractual Clauses).
dataHosting.content3: Encryption is applied to protect data both in transit and at rest.

dataRetention.title: 7. Data Retention
dataRetention.content1: Customer account data is retained for the duration of the subscription and for up to six years afterwards for accounting and legal purposes.
dataRetention.content2: Whistleblower reports are retained for as long as determined by the Customer (as Data Controller). Upon account termination, we will either delete or return all Customer Data within three months, unless law requires longer retention.
dataRetention.content3: Technical logs are kept for security monitoring for up to 12 months.

disclosure.title: 8. Disclosure of Personal Data
disclosure.content1: We do not sell or rent personal data. We may disclose data only to:

items.2: Trusted service providers (e.g. hosting, payment processing) under strict confidentiality agreements
items.3: Regulatory or law enforcement bodies if required by law

security.title: 9. Security
security.content1: We implement technical and organisational measures to protect personal data, including:

yourRights.title: 10. Your Rights
yourRights.content1: Depending on your role (Customer or Whistleblower) and applicable law, you may have rights to:

items.5: Port your data to another provider
items.6: Lodge a complaint with your supervisory authority (e.g. the ICO in the UK)

yourRights.content2: If you are a whistleblower, you should contact the Customer (your organisation) to exercise your rights, as they are the Data Controller.

cookies.title: 11. Cookies
cookies.content: Disclosurely uses only essential cookies required for functionality and security. We do not use advertising or tracking cookies.

changes.title: 12. Changes to this Policy
changes.content: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. Material changes will be notified to Customers by email or via the Service.

contact.content1: If you have questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy, please contact:
